description: a(n)=T(n,3), array T as in A049600.
comments: If X_1, X_2, ..., X_n are 2-blocks of a (2n+3)-set X then, for n>=1, a(n+1) is the number of (n+3)-subsets of X intersecting each X_i, (i=1,2,...,n). - _Milan Janjic_, Nov 18 2007
references: R. Cori, G. Hetyei, How to count genus one partitions, FPSAC 2014, Chicago, Discrete Mathematics and Theoretical Computer Science (DMTCS), Nancy, France, 2014, 333-344; http://www.dmtcs.org/dmtcs-ojs/index.php/proceedings/article/viewFile/dmAT0130/4488
S. Kitaev, J. Remmel, p-Ascent Sequences, arXiv preprint arXiv:1503.00914, 2015
links: R. Cori, G. Hetyei, Counting genus one partitions and permutations, arXiv preprint arXiv:1306.4628, 2013
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (8,-24,32,-16)
formula: G.f.: x*(1-x)^3 /(1-2*x)^4.a(n) = sum{k=0..floor((n+3)/2), C(n+3, 2k)C(k+1, 3)}. - _Paul Barry_, May 15 2003a(n+1) = 2^n*n^3/48 + 5*2^n*n^2/16 + 7*2^n*n/6 + 2^n, n=1,2,... - _Milan Janjic_, Nov 18 2007Binomial transform of the tetrahedral numbers A000292 when omitting the initial 0 in both sequences. - _Carl Najafi_, Sep 08 2011
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[x (1-x)^3/(1-2x)^4,{x,0,30}],x] (* or *) Join[ {0},LinearRecurrence[{8,-24,32,-16},{1,5,19,63},30]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 07 2014 *)
crossrefs: Row sums of triangle A055252. a(n+1)= A055584(n, 0), n >= 0.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
